project.name: hpgl
project.description: A Node.js library to communicate with HPGL-compatible plotters and printers.

hpgl.name: hpgl
hpgl.description:
The `hpgl` library makes it possible to interact with plotters and printers that support the
*Hewlett-Packard Graphics Language* (a.k.a. *hpgl*). This language is the de facto standard for
most plotters.

Plotter.name: Plotter
Plotter.description:
The `Plotter` class provides methods to interact with an HPGL-compatible plotter such as those
made by HP starting in the 1980s. Various other makers also use or support the HPGL protocol.

By default, this library uses the Node.js [serialport](https://www.npmjs.com/package/serialport)
module for serial communication. This module offers native support on Mac, Linux and Windows. The
library can also use the [browser-serialport](https://www.npmjs.com/package/browser-serialport)
module which uses the `chrome.serial` API (only available in Chrome Apps and NW.js). For
debugging purposes, it can also use the
[virtual-serialport](https://www.npmjs.com/package/virtual-serialport).

classitems.description:
The interval (in milliseconds) to wait before sending a new instruction (so as to not overflow
the serial connection).
classitems.name: queueDelay

classitems.description: [read-only] Array of all the paper sizes supported by the device
classitems.name: supportedPapers

classitems.description: Opens a serial connection to the device.
classitems.name: connect

params.name: transport
params.description: A transport object compatible with the `serialport` API interface.

props.name: paper
props.description:
The paper size to use. Choices are:
  - *A* or *letter* (default)
  - *B* or *tabloid*
  - *A4*
  - *A3*

return.description: Returns the `Plotter` object to allow method chaining.

classitems.description:
An object that is used for serial communication. This object must adhere to the `serialport`
object's interface.
classitems.name: transport

classitems.description: Event emitted when a serial connection is successfully established to the device.
classitems.name: ready

classitems.description:
Converts centimeters to plotter units. According to the documentation, a plotter unit is
equivalent to 0.02488 millimeters.
classitems.name: cmToPlotterUnits

return.description: The converted value rounded to the closest **integer**.

params.name: error
params.description: An object containing information about the error.

classitems.description:
Event emitted when an error occurs. The specified function will receive an object with
information about the error.
classitems.name: ready

classitems.description:
Immediately sends an HPGL instruction down the serial port. The instruction is automatically
 terminated with a semicolon.
classitems.name: send

params.name: callback
params.description:
A function to call once the data has been sent. This function will
 receive an error object, if something went wrong.

return.description: Returns the `Plotter` object to allow method chaining.

classitems.description: Draws a text label. CHARACTER SETS DO NOT WORK YET!
classitems.name: drawLabel

props.name: characterSet
props.description:
The numerical ID of the character set to use to print
the label. Available sets are:
 - 0: ANSI
 - 1: 9825 Character Set
 - 2: French/German
 - 3: Scandinavian
 - 4: Spanish/Latin American
 - 6: JIS
 - 7: Roman Extensions
 - 8: Katakana
 - 9: ISO Internation Reference Version
 - 30: ISO Swedish
 - 31: ISO Swedish for Names
 - 32: ISO Norway, Version 1 (sic)
 - 33: ISO German
 - 34: ISO French
 - 35: ISO United Kingdom (sic)
 - 36: ISO Italian
 - 37: ISO Spanish
 - 38: ISO Portuguese
 - 39: ISO Norway, Version 2 (sic)

props.name: characterWidth
props.description:
The width, in centimeters, to draw the text at. A
negative value mirrors the text for that dimension.

props.name: characterHeight
props.description:
The height, in centimeters, to draw the text at.
A negative value mirrors the text for that dimension.

return.description: Returns the `Plotter` object to allow method chaining.

classitems.description:
Converts a numerical value to an integer that matches HPGL's requirements (must be between
-32768 and 32767).
classitems.name: convertToHpglInteger

classitems.description:
Converts a numerical value to floating-point decimal value respecting HPGL's requirements (must
be between -128 and 127.9999 and must a maximum of 4 decimal places).
classitems.name: convertToHpglInteger

classitems.description: Draws a circle whose center is at the current location of the pen.
classitems.name: drawCircle

params.name: angle
params.description:
An integer between -180 and 180 degrees representing the chord angle.
The most commonly used values are 0-180. In this case, the smaller the angle is, the smoother the
circle will be. Negative values make the circle start at 180 degrees instead of 0.

return.description: Returns the `Plotter` object to allow method chaining.

classitems.description: Lifts the pen and moves it to the specified x and y coordinates.
classitems.name: moveTo

return.description: Returns the `Plotter` object to allow method chaining.

classitems.description:
Queues an HPGL instruction to be sent to the serial port. If any parameters are present, they are
 appended to the 2-letter mnemonic and separated by commas.
classitems.name: queue

params.name: mnemonic
params.description: 2-letter code for the HPGL command to send

params.name: params
params.description:
A string, a number or an or array of string or numbers to use
 as parameter(s) for the instruction.

return.description: Returns the `Plotter` object to allow method chaining.
